summary: Capital One seeks a Senior Generative AI Engineer to build and maintain APIs and SDKs for large language models (LLMs) and foundation models (FMs). This role will involve architecting, building, and deploying APIs for training, fine-tuning, and prompting tasks, designing APIs for performance and scale, developing application-specific interfaces, and enabling users to build new generative AI capabilities.  The ideal candidate will have experience in NLP, speech, computer vision, or recommendation systems, familiarity with deploying large neural network models in production environments, and experience with API security, observability, and cloud access control.

company: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
title: Artificial Intelligence Integration Systems Engineer
description: Description Are you passionate about building the nation’s capability to protect and defend itself? Are you looking to advise government officials on the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in aerospace systems? If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our Space Control Systems team at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) and become our resident AI-expert with our government sponsor! The sponsor desires an in-house expert on AI-enhanced aerospace systems. You would provide guidance to teams and stakeholders on integration of AI into space-based and ground-based systems as well as providing expert review of contractor innovations. APL makes critical contributions addressing the nation’s critical challenges in scientific research and development. APL provides our sponsors with technical experts and advisors in a breadth of areas. This position will focus on AI-enhanced space-based and ground-based aerospace systems. In this position, you will draw on the bench depth of APL, communicating challenges of our sponsors and helping translate our understandings to the sponsors’ stakeholders and teams. As the AI-Integration Systems Engineer, your tasks and responsibilities will include: Applying systems engineering principles to develop, integrate, and evaluate AI-enhanced aerospace systems, ensuring the systems meet operational requirements and government needs. Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of advancements in AI and aerospace technologies. Working with government sponsors, contractors, and APL teams to define/refine requirements, solve complex challenges, and deliver innovative solutions. Working with program management as the primary technical advisor responsible for leading APL sponsor related efforts. Contributing actively to vision and strategy development for emergent efforts and future challenges. Assisting in the development of relationships with the primary sponsors and across the project communities of interest. Coordinating across APL programs and staff to ensure alignment of sponsor related tasks with other related APL programs, as required. Working with program and SES leadership to ensure that the depth and breadth of the project staff technical competencies meet the current and future needs. Fostering collaboration with line management to define and communicate project priorities and address technical risks. Serving as a technical expert and advisor on AI integration in aerospace systems, providing guidance to teams and stakeholders. Qualifications You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you... Bachelor of Science in Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science or related discipline 10+ years technical experience in Artificial Intelligence applications within complex systems. Highly effective oral and written communications skills. Ability to develop and integrate AI within complex systems. Ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical experts. Demonstrated experience in evaluating weapons effectiveness. Hold an active Top Secret clearance with an active SCI access. If selected, you will be subject to a government security investigation, to include a polygraph, and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship. This position requires travel to various locations with minimum days per week at sponsor site. You'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you... Masters or PhD in Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science or related discipline 15+ years of technical experience in Artificial Intelligence applications within complex systems. Experience working Special Access Programs. Current or previous experience with fire control architectures and defensive weapons systems. Current or previous experience with science and technology efforts supporting the Department of the Air Force, Office of the Secretary of Defense (Research and Engineering), etc. Knowledge of APL's Quality Management System Why work at APL? The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation’s most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. While we are dedicated to solving complex challenges and pioneering new technologies, what makes us truly outstanding is our culture. We offer a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere where you can bring your authentic self to work, continue to grow, and build strong connections with inspiring teammates. At APL, we celebrate our differences and encourage creativity and bold, new ideas. Our employees enjoy generous benefits, including a robust education assistance program, unparalleled retirement contributions, and a healthy work/life balance. APL’s campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at http://www.jhuapl.edu/careers. About Us APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, occupation, marital or familial status, political opinion, personal appearance, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. APL is committed to promoting an innovative environment that embraces diversity, encourages creativity, and supports inclusion of new ideas. In doing so, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals of all abilities, including those with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in any part of the hiring process, please contact Accommodations@jhuapl.edu. Only by ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard are we empowered to be bold, do great things, and make the world a better place.
summary: The Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) is seeking an AI-Integration Systems Engineer to advise government officials on the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in aerospace systems. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in AI, systems engineering, and experience working with complex systems. This position will focus on AI-enhanced space-based and ground-based aerospace systems, and the candidate will be responsible for applying systems engineering principles, maintaining up-to-date knowledge of AI advancements, working with government sponsors and contractors, and providing technical guidance to teams and stakeholders. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the nation's defense capabilities by leveraging AI in aerospace applications.

title: Data Scientist
description: Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Data Scientist II to join our team in the DMV area. We have opportunities in the Washington, DC area as well as Northern Virginia and Maryland . If you are looking for an opportunity in any of those locations, we encourage you to apply. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Performs advanced data analysis and modeling on complex datasets to drive data-driven decision making within the organization Evaluate, optimize, and/or develop models that are tailored to the mission set of the customer Works closely with cross-functional teams that include business owners, Data Engineers, and other IT stakeholders Implement statistical models and provide actionable insights to optimize business processes Collaborate with other Data Scientist IIs and take direction from more senior personnel Basic Qualifications: Bachelors degree in a STEM field Two or more (2+) years of related experience If a candidate does not have a degree at all, four (4) additional years of experience are required If a candidate holds an Associates degree rather than a Bachelors degree, two (2) additional years of experience are required Hold one of the following certifications within 6 months of commencing work on the Task Order: CCNA-Security CySA+ GICSP GSEC Security+ CE CND SSCP Preferred Qualifications: Vendor tool certifications appropriate to TDL requirements; e.g., Oracle and Mongo Clearance Requirements: This position requires an active Top Secret Clearance Physical Requirements Must be able to be in a stationary position more than 50% of the time Must be able to communicate, converse, and exchange information with peers and senior personnel Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a computer The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management, and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations The person in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc. The projected compensation range for this position is $87,200-$146,400. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. In addition, ManTech invests in it’s employees beyond just compensation. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections. For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. summary: ManTech seeks a Data Scientist II to join their team in the DMV area. Responsibilities include advanced data analysis and modeling, model optimization, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and providing actionable insights. Required qualifications include a STEM degree and 2+ years of experience, or equivalent experience. Preferred qualifications include relevant vendor tool certifications.
